quality.translation[0].definitions[0].de: how good or bad something is
quality.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Much of the land was of poor quality.
The quality of the water is reasonably good.
quality.translation[0].definitions[1].de: something that people may have as part of their character, for example courage or intelligence
quality.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: the personal qualities necessary to be a successful salesman
the qualities of honesty and independence
quality.translation[0].definitions[2].de: something that is typical of one thing and makes it different from other things, for example size, colour etc
quality.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: the physical and chemical qualities of the rock
quality.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: his pride in the quality of his craftsmanship
quality.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: I was impressed that the quality of their work was so high.
The magazine is printed on low quality paper.
The T-shirts are only $10 and the quality is excellent.
These speakers offer superior quality sound.
Our chef uses only top quality ingredients.
Scientists took samples to test the water quality.
I apologise for the poor sound quality of this recording.
Does this type of TV set have a better picture quality?
The measures will improve the quality of the water in the river.
Lack of sleep started to affect the quality of his work.
The equipment is used to monitor the city’s air quality.
Staffing problems made it difficult to maintain the quality of the service.
I think the quality has gone down over the years.
The picture quality suffers if the signal isn’t digital.
Greater investment is needed to meet the European Union’s strict quality standards.
quality.translation[1].definitions[0].de: very good – used especially by people who are trying to sell something
quality.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: quality childcare at prices people can afford
quality.translation[2].definitions[0].de: something such as courage, intelligence, or loyalty that people may have as part of their character
quality.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: You need special personal qualities to work as a nurse.
quality.translation[2].definitions[1].de: something such as size, colour, feel, or weight that makes one thing look different from other things
quality.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The analysis looks at the physical and chemical qualities of the sample.
quality.translation[2].definitions[2].de: used to talk about how good or bad something is
quality.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: the high quality of the service
She was shocked by thelow quality of the healthcare available.
quality.translation[2].definitions[3].de: used to talk about how likely an investment is to be profitable
quality.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: The bond issues carried triple-A ratings and appealed to individuals looking for high-quality securities.
quality.translation[2].definitions[4].ex: Remember it’s quality we’re looking for, so don’t rush the job.
The company has a worldwide reputation for the quality of its products.
quality.translation[2].definitions[5].de: when people stop buying low-quality products, investments etc and start buying high-quality products etc
quality.translation[2].definitions[5].ex: The company saw a flight to quality among whisky drinkers and worked to improve the image of its whisky brands.
quality.translation[3].definitions[0].de: a word meaning very good, used especially in advertising products
quality.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: We provide quality rented accommodation for professional people.
quality childcare at prices people can afford
quality.translation[3].definitions[1].de: newspapers etc aimed at educated readers
